page.title: 12Transport around Pencombe
page.content: Public transport in the map reference is very limited. A local coach firm runs a bus from Pencombe to Bromyard on Thursdays and to Hereford on Wednesdays. A school bus is provided to transport children to secondary school in Bromyard. There is also a taxi service to take children from the outlying area to the village school. Most of those living in the area own a car and rely on this for their transport. The area is served by a network of narrow country lanes, which are maintained by Malvern Hills District Council. Problems occur in winter with heavy snowfall. On the higher ground lanes may be impassable for some considerable time. In February 1985, the road from Hegdon Hill to Pencombe Cross was blocked for four weeks.
